Title:
Molecular multi-gene sequence analysis and phenotypic
diversity of Phaeoacremonium species isolated from grapevines in
Castilla y León (Spain).
Keywords:
grapevine decline, ITS, beta-tubulin, actin, calmodulin
and translation elongation factor 1-alpha.
Abstract:
Esca, Petri disease and eutypa dieback among others
grapevine decline diseases cause serious economic losses to the wine
industry worldwide and they are strongly present through Castilla y León
(Spain). In the present work 175 isolates of Phaeoacremonium spp. were
identified. Thirty one isolates of Phaeocremonium species collected from
different production areas and grapevine varieties were tested by
sequences analysis. Amplicons from six partial genes were amplified by
PCR. The 5OH of the translation elongation factor 1-alpha gene
(EF1-alpha) and 5OH of beta-tubulin gene of Phaeoacremonium spp. were
amplified for the first time. Within the six genes studied, amplicons
obtained from calmodulin partial gene and EF1-alpha were the most
informative regions showing only 52.6% and 56.6% of homology
respectively. Phylogenetic analysis of combined DNA sequence revealed
the presence of five Phaeoacremonium species isolated from diseased
grapevines. P. aleophilum was the most frequently isolated. P. mortoniae
and P. iranianum are newly reported on grapevine from Castilla y León
and La Rioja, respectably. Intra-specific variation among 23 P.
aleophilum isolates revealed the presence of 29 nucleotides differences
among the studied sequences and allowed to discriminate two main groups
by a Network analysis. Phenotypic characters were discussed.
